intro: Cladandra pygmaea, commonly known as the dwarf rockrose, is a low-growing shrub native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its small, fleshy leaves and clusters of pink or red flowers. The plant thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and inland cliffs. It is drought-tolerant and adapted to harsh environmental conditions. Its compact size and ornamental flowers make it a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping.
